sourcesContent:
import React from "react"; export default function RecipeCard(props) { const topRecipes = [ { name: "Chicken Tikka Biryani", description: "A delicious fusion of succulent chicken tikka and aromatic biryani rice, blending spices for a mouth-watering experience.", detailedRecipe: ` 1. Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, and lemon juice. Let sit for 1-2 hours. 2. Grill or pan-fry the marinated chicken until cooked and set aside. 3. In a pot, heat ghee and sauté onions, bay leaf, cinnamon, cloves, and cardamom. 4. Add basmati rice, water, salt, and let it cook until rice is 70% done. 5. Layer the partially cooked rice and grilled chicken tikka in layers, adding saffron milk, fried onions, and coriander in between. 6. Seal the pot and cook on low heat (dum) for 20 minutes. Serve hot with raita. ` }, { name: "Paneer Tikka Masala", description: "Soft paneer cubes grilled and cooked in a rich, spicy tomato gravy, making for a perfect North Indian delight.", detailedRecipe: ` 1. Marinate paneer with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, chili powder, garam masala, and lemon juice for 30 minutes. 2. Grill or pan-fry the marinated paneer until golden and set aside. 3. In a pan, heat oil and sauté onions until golden brown. Add tomato puree, spices (turmeric, chili powder, cumin powder), and cook until oil separates. 4. Add cream and grilled paneer, mixing well to coat the paneer in the gravy. 5. Garnish with coriander and serve hot with naan or rice. ` }, { name: "Chicken White Sauce Pasta", description: "Creamy pasta with tender chicken in a white sauce, seasoned with Italian herbs for a comforting meal.", detailedRecipe: ` 1. Boil pasta according to package instructions and drain. 2. In a pan, heat butter and sauté garlic. Add diced chicken and cook until golden. 3. Stir in flour to make a roux, then gradually add milk, stirring continuously until a smooth sauce forms. 4. Add Italian seasoning, salt, pepper, and cheese, cooking until the sauce thickens. 5. Add the cooked pasta and toss to coat in the sauce. Garnish with parsley and serve hot. ` }, { name: "Shahi Paneer", description: "A royal, creamy, and mildly spiced dish with paneer in a rich cashew and cream-based gravy.", detailedRecipe: ` 1. Soak cashews in warm water for 15 minutes, then blend into a smooth paste. 2. In a pan, heat ghee and sauté onions until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook. 3. Add tomato puree, spices (turmeric, chili powder, garam masala), and cook until oil separates. 4. Stir in cashew paste and cream, then add paneer cubes. Simmer for a few minutes. 5. Garnish with coriander and serve hot with naan or rice. ` }, { name: "Chicken Crispy", description: "Crispy fried chicken coated in a spicy, tangy sauce, perfect as a starter or snack.", detailedRecipe: ` 1. Marinate chicken with soy sauce, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, and cornstarch. 2. Deep-fry the marinated chicken pieces until golden and crispy. Set aside. 3. In a pan, heat oil and sauté chopped onions, bell peppers, and green chilies. 4. Add soy sauce, chili sauce, and vinegar, and cook until sauce thickens slightly. 5. Toss in fried chicken and stir until well coated. Garnish with spring onions and serve hot. ` }, { name: "Paneer Biryani", description: "A flavorful biryani made with marinated paneer and fragrant basmati rice, layered and slow-cooked to perfection.", detailedRecipe: ` 1. Marinate paneer with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, and lemon juice. Let sit for 30 minutes. 2. In a pot, heat ghee and sauté onions, bay leaf, cinnamon, cloves, and cardamom. 3. Add basmati rice, water, and salt, cooking until the rice is 70% done. 4. Layer the rice and marinated paneer in a pot, adding saffron milk, fried onions, and coriander in between. 5. Seal the pot and cook on low heat (dum) for 20 minutes. Serve hot with raita. ` } ]; return (
{props.RecipeName}
{props.Type}

{props.RecipeDescription}

View Detailed Recipe
); }
